intro: Jasione pyrenaica var. macrocephala, commonly known as the Pyrenean jasione, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of small, rounded flowers that attract pollinators. It prefers calcareous soils and is often found in open, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
